AdditionalFields.Value: Experimental and Molecular Therapeutics,Molecular/Cellular Biology and Genetics,Clinical Research,Hematologic Malignancies

Description: IDH1 and IDH2, pivotal metabolic enzymes catalyzing isocitrate to a-ketoglutarate (a-KG), are the most frequently mutated metabolic genes in human cancer. These mutations are prevalent in a significant proportion of gliomas, acute myeloid leukemia (AML), and various malignancies. In this symposium, speakers will address pre-clinical mouse models concerning IDH-mutant hematological cancer and gliomas. Furthermore, insights into recent clinical trials will be discussed, exploring their implications for IDH-mutant glioma treatment. The session will also delve into the functional significance of genetic alterations in the initiation, progression, and potentially therapy response of IDH-mutant gliomas. Overall, the session will provide a comprehensive examination of the molecular intricacies and clinical implications surrounding IDH mutations in cancer.
SearchResultBody: SY16. Biology and Treatment Strategies for IDH-mutant Cancers
Title: Biology and Treatment Strategies for IDH-mutant Cancers
